controls.description: Ensure all employees receive security awareness training
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC provides security awareness training to all employees during initial onboarding and at least annually thereafter. Significant changes or events also triggers retraining to all personnel. Security awareness training includes content on general security best practices, insider threats, social engineering, phishing, etc. Records of completion are retained for at least one year.

controls.description: Log and monitor system modifications
controls.implementationStatement:
IntelliGRC logs and monitors system modifications across its environment using centralized logging, automated alerting, and audit review procedures. These activities are carried out by the Security and CloudOps Teams.
All configuration changes, software deployments, and administrative activities, whether performed through CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code tools, or manual system management, are logged.

controls.description: Execute changes through redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC executes infrastructure and application changes through the redeployment of version-controlled, immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible. Infrastructure is provisioned and managed using Terraform, ensuring all configurations are declarative and tracked in source control. Application deployments are managed via Helm charts and orchestrated with ArgoCD, enabling automated, consistent, and auditable rollouts. This approach enforces immutability, provides a clear change history, and reduces the risk associated with manual or ad hoc modifications in the production environment.

controls.description: Implement automated testing and validation of changes prior to deployment
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC implements automated testing and validation processes for all changes prior to deployment into the production environment. These processes are integrated into the CI/CD pipeline and are aligned with FedRAMP Moderate controls to ensure the integrity and security of software and infrastructure updates. System patches are are tested in staging environments before promotion to production. Unit tests, integration tests, automated testing, and code analysis are performed during the build and release stages.

controls.description: Configure ALL information resources to limit inbound and outbound traffic
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC enforces strict controls on network traffic through layered Azure security services. Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) manages inbound web traffic, while administrative access is restricted via an Azure Bastion host secured with Network Security Groups (NSGs) and Entra ID RBAC. All outbound traffic is routed through Azure Firewall configured with least-privilege rules. All subnets have their own NSG with default deny, allow by exception rules.

controls.description: Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised
controls.implementationStatement:
The IntelliGRC SaaS environment uses a microservices architecture deployed via hardened Docker containers running in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). Core application services are logically grouped, while third-party and supporting components are isolated to minimize risk and maintain separation of duties. Service-to-service communication is tightly controlled using Linkerd network policies, with a default deny posture and explicit allow rules for only required connections.
Beyond Kubernetes, network segmentation is enforced at the Azure VNet level using dedicated subnets for different workloads. Network Security Groups (NSGs) are configured with a default deny-all rule, allowing traffic between subnets strictly by exception. This approach helps prevent unauthorized lateral movement between network segments. Additional isolation and access controls are provided through Azure Privileged Identity Management (PIM) and Just-in-Time (JIT) access policies, which limit administrative exposure and reduce the overall attack surface. Secure, auditable access from the Azure Bastion Service is enforced through Entra ID RBAC, further mitigating risks associated with lateral movement from bastion hosts.

controls.description: Have denial of service protection
controls.implementationStatement:
IntelliGRC leverages Azure Front Door as the global entry point for web traffic, providing integrated protection at both the network and application layers. Azure Front Door works with DDoS Protection Standard to automatically detect, analyze, and mitigate distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks, helping to ensure service availability and resilience.
Additionally, Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) is enabled to defend against common web application threats. The WAF managed rule set protects against attacks such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS), while custom rules enable blocking or redirecting based on geographic region, IP address, or traffic patterns. Rate limiting is applied to prevent abuse, and bot protection rules guard against known malicious bots.

controls.description: Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC is architected for high availability and rapid recovery through a geographically redundant Azure infrastructure deployed across multiple availability zones within the East US region. Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) worker nodes are distributed across these zones to ensure that workloads remain available in the event of a zone failure. Pod Disruption Budgets (PDBs) are implemented to maintain minimum service levels during planned or unplanned disruptions, preventing simultaneous evictions that could impact application availability. Backup and restoration capabilities are provided via Azure Blob Storage snapshots and regular database backups, in alignment with a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 24 hours and a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 8 hours. All backup and recovery procedures are fully tested annually and audited as part of FedRAMP compliance.

controls.description: Report incidents according to FedRAMP requirements and cloud service provider policies
controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC reports incidents in accordance with FedRAMP requirements by following a structured notification flow. Upon discovery, the CISO and Operations Team document the incident and notify the FedRAMP PMO and Authorizing Official within 1 hour, per FedRAMP guidance. The initial report is followed by a 4-hour preliminary report and a comprehensive report within 72 hours. These actions are governed by the Incident Response Plan (IRP) and include coordination with US-CERT or CISA where applicable.

controls.description: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities
controls.implementationStatement:
All incidents are logged and managed in Microsoft Sentinel, which serves as the centralized incident management platform. When new incidents are generated, the InfoSec Team is immediately notified via email and Microsoft Teams to ensure timely awareness and response.
Incidents are reviewed and investigated daily, rather than monthly, to provide rapid detection and remediation of potential threats. In addition, IntelliGRC leverages threat intelligence indicators of compromise (IOCs) to analyze historical logs, trace malicious activity, and validate whether similar attack patterns have previously occurred.

controls.implementationStatement: IntelliGRC operates a centralized Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platform to collect, correlate, and analyze system-generated event logs across the FedRAMP Moderate boundary. The SIEM system supports tamper-resistant logging by ingesting logs from host-based agents, container platforms, cloud-native logging services, and CI/CD pipeline events, with access restrictions enforced through Entra ID role-based controls. This system enables correlation of disparate monitoring information and supports intrusion detection across system interfaces.

controls.description: Build security considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle and align with CISA Secure By Design principles
controls.implementationStatement:
IntelliGRC incorporates security throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) in alignment with FedRAMP Moderate controls and core CISA Secure by Design principles. Security is built into design, development, testing, and deployment stages through a combination of procedural safeguards, cross-team collaboration, and automated tooling.
The Development and CloudOps Teams apply secure coding practices, input validation (SI-10), and error handling controls (SI-11) as part of normal development activities. Code and configuration changes undergo peer review, static code analysis, and integrity validation prior to deployment into production.
The QA and Security Teams perform flaw remediation testing, validate system behavior under transitional conditions, and coordinate remediation through the change control process (SI-02, SI-06).
Security testing is integrated into the CI/CD pipelines to detect unauthorized code, validate signatures, and ensure that infrastructure-as-code deployments comply with organizational security baselines.
